law.catch_line: Hotels, motels, etc.—Driver soliciting patronage of passengers for.

text.section:
Sec. 31-68. Hotels, motels, etc.—Driver soliciting patronage of passengers for.
It shall be unlawful for the driver or operator of any taxicab or other passenger vehicle for hire, while engaged in such occupation within the incorporated or unincorporated areas of Miami-Dade County, to solicit the patronage of any passenger, prospective passenger, or other person in behalf of any hotel, motel, apartment house, restaurant, night club, bar, or other business establishment.
